sen.j: 忠快（ちゅうかい、応保2年（1162年） - 嘉禄3年3月16日 (旧暦)（1227年4月3日））は、平安時代末期から鎌倉時代初期にかけての天台宗の僧。
sen.e: Chukai (1162 - April 10, 1227) was a monk of the Tendai sect who lived from the late Heian period to the beginning of the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: 1227年4月3日: ユリウス暦の日付ですので、グレゴリオ暦に直しています。
sen.e: Chukai (born in 1162; died on April 10, 1227) was a monk of the Tendai Sect during the late Heian period and early Kamakura period.
Chukai (born in 1162; died on April 10, 1227) was a priest of the Tendai Sect during the late Heian period and early Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: monk を priest に修正しました。

sen.j: 法印、権大僧都。
sen.e: He held the positions of hoin (the highest rank among Buddhist priests) and gon daisozu (Junior prelate).
He held the positions of Hoin (the highest rank among Buddhist monks) and Gon Daisozu (Junior Prelate).
He held the positions of Hoin (the highest rank in the hierarchy of Buddhist priests) and Gon Daisozu (the provisional second highest position, upper grade, of priest).
sen.cmt: 法印 (the highest rank among Buddhist monks) を (the highest rank in the hierarchy of Buddhist priests) に修正しました。権大僧都用語集の表記に従い(Junior Prelate) を(the provisional second highest position, upper grade, of priest) に修正しました（※）。※ただし、12セル目に出てくる「権少僧都」との表記が一致しません。

sen.j: 中納言律師と呼ばれる。
sen.e: He is also called Chunagon (vice-councilor of state) risshi (Buddhist priest).
sen.cmt: 中納言律師: 読み方・定訳ともに確認できませんが、読みは「ちゅうなごんりっし」と推測し、「中納言」「律師」として、それぞれ用語集に登録されている訳語を充てています。尚、「中納言」には複数の訳語が登録されていますが、用語統一リストに記載されている訳語を充てています。
sen.e: He was also called Chunagon (Vice-Councilor of the State) Risshi (Buddhist monk).
He was also called Chunagon (vice-Councilor of the State) Risshi (Buddhist priest).
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に従いVice-Councilor を vice-councilor に修正しました。monk を priest に修正しました。

sen.j: 字は「仲快」とも。
sen.e: His name "Chukai" can be written also in two kanji (Chinese character) "仲快."
His name "Chukai" can also be written as "仲快."
His name "Chukai" can also be written as "仲快."

sen.j: 平清盛の弟・門脇中納言平教盛を父として生まれる。
sen.e: He was born as a younger brother of TAIRA no Kiyomori, and also as a son of Kadowaki chunagon (Middle Counselor Kadowaki), TAIRA no Norimori.
sen.cmt: 門脇中納言: 用語集の訳語を用いています(単語「counselor」は、「中納言」として用語統一リストに記載されている訳語内の「councilor」とは異なります)
sen.e: He was born as a younger brother of TAIRA no Kiyomori, and also as a son of Kadowaki Chunagon (Vice-Councilor of Kadowaki), TAIRA no Norimori.
He was born as a son of Kadowaki Chunagon (Vice-Councilor of Kadowaki), TAIRA no Norimori, who was a younger brother of TAIRA no Kiyomori.
sen.cmt: 誤訳のため全文修正しました。（※）※ 清盛の弟（異母弟）は忠快の父・教盛であって、忠快本人ではありません。

sen.j: 覚快法親王の門下において、安元2年（1176年）に受戒。
sen.e: He vowed to follow the precepts as a disciple of Cloistered Imperial Prince Kakukai in 1176.
sen.cmt: 受戒: 用語集の訳語とは異なりますが、「http://tangorin.com/words/受戒」の訳語を充てています。
sen.e: He vowed to follow Buddha's Dharma as a disciple of Cloistered Imperial Prince Kakukai in 1176.
He received the religious precept as a disciple of Cloistered Imperial Prince Kakukai in 1176.
sen.cmt: 受戒用語集の表記に従い、vowed to follow Buddha's Dharma をreceived the religious precept に修正しました。

sen.j: 慈円や玄理に師事し、青蓮院に住する。
sen.e: He studied under Jien and Genri and lived in Shoren-in Temple.
sen.cmt: 玄理: 読み方が確認できませんが、「げんり」と推測して表記しています。
sen.e: He studied under Jien and Genri and resided in Shoren-in Temple.
He studied under Jien and Genri and resided in Shoren-in Temple.

sen.j: 平氏政権下において権少僧都まで進む。
sen.e: He was advanced to gon shosozu (Junior lesser prelate) under the Taira clan government.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Chukai was promoted to Gon Shosozu (Junior Lesser Prelate) under the Taira Clan Administration.
Chukai was promoted to Gon Shosozu (a provisional junior rank in the second highest managerial position) under the Taira Clan Administration.
sen.cmt: 権小僧都用語集の表記に従い、(Junior Lesser Prelate) を(a provisional junior rank in the second highest managerial position) に修正しました（※）。※ 5セル目の「権大僧都」との表記が一致しません。

sen.j: だが、寿永2年（1183年）に平家一門とともに都落ちした。
sen.e: But he had to leave the capital with the Taira clan in 1183.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: But he was forced to leave the Capital along with the Taira Clan in 1183.
But he was forced to leave the Capital along with the Taira Clan in 1183.

sen.j: 二年後の元暦2年（1185年）の壇ノ浦の戦いにおいて捕虜となった。
sen.e: Two years later in 1185, he was taken captive in the Battle of Dan no ura.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Two years later in 1185, he was taken captive during the Battle of Dan no Ura.
Two years later in 1185, he was taken captive during the Battle of Dan no Ura.

sen.j: 同年伊豆国へと配流される。
sen.e: In that year, he was exiled to Izu Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Later that year, he was exiled to the Izu Province.
Later that year, he was exiled to the Izu Province.

sen.j: 伊豆においては狩野宗茂の監視下で過ごす。
sen.e: He was placed under observation of Munemochi KANO in Izu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Chukai was placed under custody of Munemochi KANO in Izu.
Chukai was placed under custody of Munemochi KANO in Izu.

sen.j: この間源頼朝や御家人からの帰依を受ける。
sen.e: He accepted his becoming believers such as MINAMOTO no Yoritomo and gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods) in Buddhism during this period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: During this time, Chukai accepted new followers of Buddhism such as MINAMOTO no Yoritomo and gokenin (an immediate vassal of the Shogunate during the Kamakura, Muromachi, and Edo periods).
During this time, Chukai accepted new followers of Buddhism such as MINAMOTO no Yoritomo and gokenin (an immediate vassal of the Shogunate during the Kamakura, Muromachi, and Edo periods).

sen.j: やがて文治5年（1189年）には帰洛。
sen.e: Then he returned to Kyoto in 1189.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He then returned to Kyoto in 1189.
He then returned to Kyoto in 1189.

sen.j: 父教盛の所有地であった三条小川高畠の地を返却された。
sen.e: The land owned by his father Norimori in Sanjo ogawa takahata was returned to him.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 / 三条小川高畠: 読み方が確認できませんが、「さんじょうおがわたかはた」と推測して表記しています。
sen.e: The land previously owned by his father, Norimori, in Sanjo Ogawa Takahata was returned to Chukai.
The land previously owned by his father, Norimori, in Sanjo Ogawa Takahata was returned to Chukai.

sen.j: 同所に宝菩提院を営む。
sen.e: He ran Hobodai-in Temple at the same place.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 / 宝菩提院: 用語集には「Hobodai-in」と登録されていますが、指示書の指示に従い、「Temple」を付けました。
sen.e: He managed Hobodai-in Temple at that location.
He managed Hobodai-in Temple at that location.

sen.j: 建久6年（1195年）には頼朝に随って再度関東に下向。
sen.e: He accompanied MINAMOTO no Yoritomo to go to Kanto again in 1195.
In 1195, Chukai accompanied MINAMOTO no Yoritomo to Kanto once again.
In 1195, Chukai accompanied MINAMOTO no Yoritomo to Kanto once again.

sen.j: 建仁3年（1203年）には慈円の譲りにより権少僧都に還任。
sen.e: He was reappointed to gon shosozu by transfer of the position by Jien.
In 1203, Jien passed on to Chukai the title of Gon Shosozu, a title he once held before.
In 1203, Jien passed on to Chukai the title of Gon Shosozu, a title he once held before.

sen.j: さらに法眼、権大僧都と進んだ。
sen.e: He was further advanced to hogen (the second highest rank for Buddhist priests) and gon daisozu.
He continued to advance to Jogen (the second highest rank for Buddhist monks) and Gon Daisozu.
He continued to advance to Hogen (the second highest rank in the hierarchy of Buddhist priests) and Gon Daisozu.
sen.cmt: 法眼Hogen (the second highest rank in the hierarchy of Buddhist priests) に修正しました。

sen.j: 三代将軍源実朝の信頼も厚かった。
sen.e: The third shogun MINAMOTO no Sanetomo also put full confidence in him.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Third Shogun, MINAMOTO no Sanetomo, also placed his full trust and confidence in him.
The Third Shogun, MINAMOTO no Sanetomo, also placed his full trust and confidence in him.

sen.j: その招きにより数度に渡って関東を訪問している。
sen.e: He visited Kanto several times at the invitation of the shogun.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He visited Kanto several times at the invitation of the Shogun.
He visited Kanto several times at the invitation of the Shogun.

sen.j: 一方、京においては後高倉院の帰依を受ける。
sen.e: On the other hand, he accepted Gotakakura-in as his becoming believer in Buddhism in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処(分割前は文尾に「など」が付いていましたが、これがあると不完全な文のままなので省略しています)
sen.e: In Kyoto, he accepted Gotakakura-in who was a new follower of Buddhism.
In Kyoto, on the other hand, he accepted Gotakakurain's devotion.
sen.cmt: In Kyoto, he accepted Gotakakura-in who was a new follower of Buddhism. をIn Kyoto, on the other hand, he accepted Gotakakurain's devotion. に修正しました(※)。※帰依神仏や高僧を信じてその力にすがること。http://kotobank.jp/word/%E5%B8%B0%E4%BE%9Dよって devotion の訳を選択しました。http://tangorin.com/words/帰依

sen.j: 朝廷・幕府の双方からの尊崇を集める高僧であった。
sen.e: He was a high priest who was worshiped by the Imperial Court as well as by Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Chukai was a high-ranking monk who was worshipped by the Imperial Court as well as by the Kamakura Bakufu (the Japanese Feudal Government headed by a Shogun).
Chukai was a high-ranking priest who was worshipped by the Imperial Court as well as by the Kamakura Bakufu (the Japanese Feudal Government headed by a Shogun).
sen.cmt: monk を priest に修正しました。

sen.j: 承久年間には比叡山の横川の長吏にも就任している。
sen.e: He also assumed the position of chori (chief priest) of Yokawa Precincts on Mt. Hiei in the Jokyu era.
sen.cmt: 横川: 定訳不明。読み方は「よかわ」で、比叡山の三塔のひとつ(http://kotobank.jp/word/%E6%A8%AA%E5%B7%9D)。「塔」は建物の塔ではなく、延暦寺の区域を指すようなので、「延暦寺横川」として登録されている訳語の一部「Yokawa Precincts」を充てています。
sen.e: He also assumed the position of Chori (Chief Monk) of the Yokawa Precincts on Mt. Hiei during the Jokyu era.
He also assumed the position of Chori (chief priest) of the Yokawa Precincts on Mt. Hiei during the Jokyu era.
sen.cmt: 長吏 (Chief Monk) を(chief priest）に修正しました。

sen.j: その教学は後世「小川流」と呼ばれ、台密十三流の一派を形成した。
sen.e: His doctrine was called 'Ogawa school' after ages, which constituted one of the thirteen schools of Taimitsu (esoteric Buddhism of the Japanese Tendai sect).
sen.cmt: 台密十三流: 定訳は不明ですが、「台密(天台宗の密教)」として用語集に登録されている訳語を用いて訳しています。
sen.e: Later generations called his doctrine "Ogawa School", which constituted one of the Thirteen Schools of the Taimitsu (Esoteric Buddhism of the Japanese Tendai Sect).
Later generations called his doctrine 'Ogawa School,' which constituted one of the Thirteen Schools of the Taimitsu (Esoteric Buddhism of the Japanese Tendai Sect).
sen.cmt: ダブルクォーテーションをシングルクォーテーションに修正しました。
